doc.summary: Provides outgoing messages for , given random arguments to the function.

message_doc.name: LogAverageFactor(bool, IList{bool})
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's average value across the given argument distributions.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(factor(allTrue,array)).

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio(bool, IList{bool})
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's contribution the EP model evidence.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(factor(allTrue,array)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.name: AverageLogFactor(bool, IList{bool})
message_doc.returns: Zero.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(factor(allTrue,array)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for VMP.

message_doc.name: LogAverageFactor(Bernoulli, Bernoulli)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from allTrue. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's average value across the given argument distributions.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(allTrue) p(allTrue) factor(allTrue,array)).

message_doc.name: LogAverageFactor(bool, IList{Bernoulli})
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's average value across the given argument distributions.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(array) p(array) factor(allTrue,array)).

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio(Bernoulli)
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's contribution the EP model evidence.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(allTrue) p(allTrue) factor(allTrue,array) / sum_allTrue p(allTrue) messageTo(allTrue)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio(bool, IList{Bernoulli})
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's contribution the EP model evidence.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(array) p(array) factor(allTrue,array)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.name: AllTrueAverageConditional(IList{Bernoulli})
message_doc.returns: The outgoing EP message to the allTrue argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of allTrue as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(allTrue) sum_(array) p(array) factor(allTrue,array)]/p(allTrue).

message_doc.name: AllTrueAverageConditional(IList{bool})
message_doc.returns: The outgoing EP message to the allTrue argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the factor viewed as a function of allTrue conditioned on the given values.

message_doc.name: ArrayAverageConditional{BernoulliList}(Bernoulli, IList{Bernoulli}, BernoulliList)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from allTrue. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of array as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(array) sum_(allTrue) p(allTrue) factor(allTrue,array)]/p(array).

message_doc.name: ArrayAverageConditional{BernoulliList}(bool, IList{Bernoulli}, BernoulliList)
message_doc.param: Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the factor viewed as a function of array conditioned on the given values.

message_doc.name: ArrayAverageConditional{BernoulliList}(Bernoulli, IList{bool}, BernoulliList)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from allTrue. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of array as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(array) sum_(allTrue) p(allTrue) factor(allTrue,array)]/p(array).

message_doc.name: AllTrueAverageLogarithm(IList{Bernoulli})
message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the allTrue argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of allTrue as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[sum_(array) p(array) factor(allTrue,array)].

message_doc.name: ArrayAverageLogarithm{BernoulliList}(Bernoulli, IList{Bernoulli}, BernoulliList)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from allTrue. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the factor viewed as a function of array with allTrue integrated out. The formula is sum_allTrue p(allTrue) factor(allTrue,array).

message_doc.name: ArrayAverageLogarithm{BernoulliList}(bool, IList{Bernoulli}, BernoulliList)
message_doc.param: Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the factor viewed as a function of array conditioned on the given values.

message_doc.name: AverageLogFactor()
message_doc.returns: Zero.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(factor(allTrue,array)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for VMP.

message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the and argument.

message_doc.name: AAverageLogarithm(Bernoulli, Bernoulli)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from and. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the a argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except a. Because the factor is deterministic, and is integrated out before taking the logarithm. The formula is exp(sum_(b) p(b) log(sum_and p(and) factor(and,a,b))).

message_doc.name: AAverageLogarithm(Bernoulli, bool)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from and. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the a argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the factor viewed as a function of a with and integrated out. The formula is sum_and p(and) factor(and,a,b).

message_doc.param: Incoming message from enter. Must be a proper distribution. If all elements are uniform, the result will be uniform.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of value as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(value) sum_(enter,selector) p(enter,selector) factor(enter,selector,value)]/p(value).

message_doc.returns: Zero.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(factor(enter,selector,value)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for VMP.

message_doc.param: Modified to contain the outgoing message.

message_doc.name: SelectorAverageLogarithm(Discrete)
message_doc.param: Modified to contain the outgoing message.

message_doc.name: ValueAverageLogarithm{TDist}(IList{TDist}, Discrete, TDist)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from enter. Must be a proper distribution. If all elements are uniform, the result will be uniform.
Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except value. Because the factor is deterministic, enter is integrated out before taking the logarithm. The formula is exp(sum_(selector) p(selector) log(sum_enter p(enter) factor(enter,selector,value))).

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of exitTwo as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(exitTwo) sum_(case0,case1,values) p(case0,case1,values) factor(exitTwo,case0,case1,values)]/p(exitTwo).

message_doc.name: AverageLogFactor{TExit}(TExit, Bernoulli, Bernoulli, IList{TExit}, TExit)
message_doc.returns: Zero.

remarks.para: In Variational Message Passing, the evidence contribution of a deterministic factor is zero. Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for VMP.

message_doc.name: ValuesAverageLogarithm{TExit, TResultList}(TExit, TResultList)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from exitTwo. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the factor viewed as a function of values with exitTwo integrated out. The formula is sum_exitTwo p(exitTwo) factor(exitTwo,case0,case1,values).

message_doc.name: Case0AverageLogarithm{TExit}(TExit, IList{TExit})
message_doc.param: Incoming message from values. Must be a proper distribution. If any element is uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the case0 argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except case0. Because the factor is deterministic, exitTwo is integrated out before taking the logarithm. The formula is exp(sum_(values) p(values) log(sum_exitTwo p(exitTwo) factor(exitTwo,case0,case1,values))).

message_doc.name: Case1AverageLogarithm{TExit}(TExit, IList{TExit})
message_doc.param: Incoming message from values. Must be a proper distribution. If any element is uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the case1 argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except case1. Because the factor is deterministic, exitTwo is integrated out before taking the logarithm. The formula is exp(sum_(values) p(values) log(sum_exitTwo p(exitTwo) factor(exitTwo,case0,case1,values))).

message_doc.name: ExitTwoAverageLogarithm{TExit}(Bernoulli, Bernoulli, IList{TExit}, TExit)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from values. Must be a proper distribution. If any element is uniform, the result will be uniform.
Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of exitTwo as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[sum_(case0,case1,values) p(case0,case1,values) factor(exitTwo,case0,case1,values)].

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio(Bernoulli, double)
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's contribution the EP model evidence.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(sample) p(sample) factor(sample,probTrue) / sum_sample p(sample) messageTo(sample)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.name: CharacterAverageConditional(Dirichlet)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from probabilities. Must be a proper distribution. If any element is uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing EP message to the character argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of character as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(character) sum_(probabilities) p(probabilities) factor(character,probabilities)]/p(character).

message_doc.name: ProbabilitiesAverageConditional(DiscreteChar, Dirichlet, Dirichlet)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from character. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of probabilities as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(probabilities) sum_(character) p(character) factor(character,probabilities)]/p(probabilities).

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio(Dirichlet, DiscreteChar)
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's contribution the EP model evidence.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(probabilities,character) p(probabilities,character) factor(character,probabilities) / sum_character p(character) messageTo(character)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio(Dirichlet, Char)

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(probabilities) p(probabilities) factor(character,probabilities)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.name: FirstAverageLogarithm(VectorGaussian, VectorGaussian, VectorGaussian)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from concat. Must be a proper distribution. If any element is uniform, the result will be uniform.
Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except first. Because the factor is deterministic, concat is integrated out before taking the logarithm. The formula is exp(sum_(second) p(second) log(sum_concat p(concat) factor(concat,first,second))).

message_doc.name: SumAverageLogarithm(WrappedGaussian, WrappedGaussian)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from difference. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
Incoming message from b. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the a argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except a. message_doc.returns: The outgoing EP message to the difference argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of difference as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(difference) sum_(a) p(a) factor(difference,a,b)]/p(difference).

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of difference as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(difference) sum_(b) p(b) factor(difference,a,b)]/p(difference).

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(difference) p(difference) factor(difference,a,b)).

message_doc.name: AverageLogFactor()
message_doc.returns: Zero.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(factor(difference,a,b)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for VMP.

message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the difference argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the factor viewed as a function of difference conditioned on the given values.

message_doc.name: AAverageLogarithm(Gaussian, Gaussian)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from difference. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
Incoming message from b. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the a argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except a. Because the factor is deterministic, difference is integrated out before taking the logarithm. The formula is exp(sum_(b) p(b) log(sum_difference p(difference) factor(difference,a,b))).

message_doc.name: AAverageLogarithm(Gaussian, double)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from difference. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the a argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the factor viewed as a function of a with difference integrated out. The formula is sum_difference p(difference) factor(difference,a,b).

message_doc.name: LogAverageFactor(Dirichlet, Vector, Dirichlet)
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's average value across the given argument distributions.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(sampleFromPseudoCounts) p(sampleFromPseudoCounts) factor(sampleFromPseudoCounts,pseudoCount)).

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio(Dirichlet, Vector)
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's contribution the EP model evidence.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(sampleFromPseudoCounts) p(sampleFromPseudoCounts) factor(sampleFromPseudoCounts,pseudoCount) / sum_sampleFromPseudoCounts p(sampleFromPseudoCounts) messageTo(sampleFromPseudoCounts)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

Incoming message from mean. Must be a proper distribution. If any element is uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's average value across the given argument distributions.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(prob,mean) p(prob,mean) factor(prob,mean,totalCount)).

message_doc.name: LogAverageFactor(Vector, Dirichlet, Gamma)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from mean. Must be a proper distribution. If any element is uniform, the result will be uniform.
Incoming message from totalCount. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's average value across the given argument distributions.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(mean,totalCount) p(mean,totalCount) factor(prob,mean,totalCount)).

message_doc.name: LogAverageFactor(Vector, Dirichlet, double)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from mean. Must be a proper distribution. If any element is uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's average value across the given argument distributions.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(mean) p(mean) factor(prob,mean,totalCount)).

message_doc.name: ProbAverageConditional(Dirichlet, Gamma)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from mean. Must be a proper distribution. If any element is uniform, the result will be uniform.
Incoming message from totalCount. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing EP message to the prob argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of prob as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(prob) sum_(mean,totalCount) p(mean,totalCount) factor(prob,mean,totalCount)]/p(prob).

message_doc.name: ProbAverageConditional(Dirichlet, double)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from mean. Must be a proper distribution. If any element is uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing EP message to the prob argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of prob as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(prob) sum_(mean) p(mean) factor(prob,mean,totalCount)]/p(prob).

message_doc.name: ProbAverageConditional(Vector, Gamma)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from totalCount. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing EP message to the prob argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of prob as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(prob) sum_(totalCount) p(totalCount) factor(prob,mean,totalCount)]/p(prob).

message_doc.name: ProbAverageConditional(Vector, double)
message_doc.returns: The outgoing EP message to the prob argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the factor viewed as a function of prob conditioned on the given values.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of mean as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(mean) sum_(totalCount) p(totalCount) factor(prob,mean,totalCount)]/p(mean).

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio(int, Dirichlet)
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's contribution the EP model evidence.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(probs) p(probs) factor(sample,probs)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio(int, Vector)

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(sample,probs) p(sample,probs) factor(sample,probs) / sum_sample p(sample) messageTo(sample)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(sample) p(sample) factor(sample,probs) / sum_sample p(sample) messageTo(sample)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.name: AAverageLogarithm(Gaussian, Gaussian)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from product. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
Incoming message from b. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the a argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except a. Because the factor is deterministic, product is integrated out before taking the logarithm. The formula is exp(sum_(b) p(b) log(sum_product p(product) factor(product,a,b))).

message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the a argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the factor viewed as a function of a with product integrated out. The formula is sum_product p(product) factor(product,a,b).

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio(Gamma, Gamma, double)
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's contribution the EP model evidence.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(product,a) p(product,a) factor(product,a,b) / sum_product p(product) messageTo(product)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.name: ProductAverageLogarithm(Gamma, Gamma)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from a. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
Incoming message from b. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the product argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of product as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[sum_(a,b) p(a,b) factor(product,a,b)].

message_doc.name: ProductAverageLogarithm(double, Gamma)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from b. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.

message_doc.name: AAverageLogarithm(Gamma, Gamma)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from product. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
Incoming message from b. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the a argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except a. Because the factor is deterministic, product is integrated out before taking the logarithm. The formula is exp(sum_(b) p(b) log(sum_product p(product) factor(product,a,b))).

message_doc.name: AAverageLogarithm(double, Gamma)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from b. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the a argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except a. The formula is exp(sum_(b) p(b) log(factor(product,a,b))).

message_doc.param: Incoming message from product. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the a argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the factor viewed as a function of a with product integrated out. The formula is sum_product p(product) factor(product,a,b).

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of casesInt as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(casesInt) sum_(i) p(i) factor(casesInt,i,count)]/p(casesInt).

message_doc.name: IAverageConditional(IList{Bernoulli}, Discrete)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from casesInt. Must be a proper distribution. If all elements are uniform, the result will be uniform.
Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of i as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(i) sum_(casesInt) p(casesInt) factor(casesInt,i,count)]/p(i).

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio(IList{Bernoulli}, Discrete)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from casesInt. Must be a proper distribution. If all elements are uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's contribution the EP model evidence.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(casesInt,i) p(casesInt,i) factor(casesInt,i,count) / sum_casesInt p(casesInt) messageTo(casesInt)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.param: Modified to contain the outgoing message.

message_doc.name: SampleAverageConditional(Gaussian, Gamma)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from mean. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
Incoming message from precision. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing EP message to the sample argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of sample as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(sample) sum_(mean,precision) p(mean,precision) factor(sample,mean,precision)]/p(sample).

message_doc.name: MeanAverageConditional(Gaussian, Gamma)

Incoming message from precision. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing EP message to the mean argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of mean as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(mean) sum_(sample,precision) p(sample,precision) factor(sample,mean,precision)]/p(mean).

message_doc.name: LogAverageFactor(IList{IList{IList{T}}}, IList{T}, IList{IList{IList{int}}})
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's average value across the given argument distributions.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(items,array,indices) p(items,array,indices) factor(items,array,indices)).

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio(IList{IList{IList{T}}}, IList{T}, IList{IList{IList{int}}})
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's contribution the EP model evidence.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(items,array,indices) p(items,array,indices) factor(items,array,indices) / sum_items p(items) messageTo(items)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.name: AverageLogFactor(IList{IList{IList{T}}}, IList{T}, IList{IList{IList{int}}})
message_doc.returns: Zero.

remarks.para: In Variational Message Passing, the evidence contribution of a deterministic factor is zero. Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for VMP.

message_doc.name: ItemsAverageLogarithm{ItemType, ItemType2, DistributionType}(IList{DistributionType}, IList{IList{IList{int}}}, int, ItemType)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from array. Must be a proper distribution. If all elements are uniform, the result will be uniform.
Index of the items for which a message is desired.

message_doc.name: ArrayAverageLogarithm{ItemType, ItemType2, DistributionType, ArrayType}(IList{ItemType}, IList{IList{IList{int}}}, ArrayType)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from items. Must be a proper distribution. If all elements are uniform, the result will be uniform.
Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except array. Because the factor is deterministic, items is integrated out before taking the logarithm. The formula is exp(sum_(indices) p(indices) log(sum_items p(items) factor(items,array,indices))).

message_doc.name: ArrayAverageLogarithm{DistributionType, ArrayType}(IList{IList{IList{T}}}, IList{IList{IList{int}}}, ArrayType)

message_doc.param: Incoming message from array. Must be a proper distribution. If all elements are uniform, the result will be uniform.
Index of the items for which a message is desired.
Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of items as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(items) sum_(array,indices) p(array,indices) factor(items,array,indices)]/p(items).

doc.summary: Provides outgoing messages for , given random arguments to the function.

message_doc.name: LogAverageFactor(IList{T}, IList{IList{IList{T}}}, IList{int}, IList{int}, IList{int})
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's average value across the given argument distributions.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(items,array,indices,indices2,indices3) p(items,array,indices,indices2,indices3) factor(items,array,indices,indices2,indices3)).

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio(IList{T}, IList{IList{IList{T}}}, IList{int}, IList{int}, IList{int})
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's contribution the EP model evidence.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(items,array,indices,indices2,indices3) p(items,array,indices,indices2,indices3) factor(items,array,indices,indices2,indices3) / sum_items p(items) messageTo(items)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.name: AverageLogFactor(IList{T}, IList{IList{IList{T}}}, IList{int}, IList{int}, IList{int})
message_doc.returns: Zero.

remarks.para: In Variational Message Passing, the evidence contribution of a deterministic factor is zero. Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for VMP.

message_doc.name: ArrayAverageConditional{ArrayType, DistributionArrayArrayType, DistributionArrayType, DistributionType}(IList{DistributionType}, IList{int}, IList{int}, IList{int}, ArrayType)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from items. Must be a proper distribution. If all elements are uniform, the result will be uniform.
Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of array as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(array) sum_(items,indices,indices2,indices3) p(items,indices,indices2,indices3) factor(items,array,indices,indices2,indices3)]/p(array).

message_doc.name: ArrayAverageConditional{ArrayType, DistributionArrayArrayType, DistributionArrayType, DistributionType}(IList{T}, IList{int}, IList{int}, IList{int}, ArrayType)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from items. Must be a proper distribution. If all elements are uniform, the result will be uniform.
Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of array as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(array) sum_(items,indices,indices2,indices3) p(items,indices,indices2,indices3) factor(items,array,indices,indices2,indices3)]/p(array).

message_doc.name: ItemsAverageLogarithm{DistributionArrayArrayType, DistributionArrayType, DistributionType}(IList{DistributionArrayArrayType}, IList{int}, IList{int}, IList{int}, int, DistributionType)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from array. Must be a proper distribution. If all elements are uniform, the result will be uniform.
Index of the items for which a message is desired.
Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of items as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[sum_(array,indices,indices2,indices3) p(array,indices,indices2,indices3) factor(items,array,indices,indices2,indices3)].

message_doc.name: ArrayAverageLogarithm{DistributionArrayArrayType, DistributionArrayType, DistributionType, ArrayType}(IList{DistributionType}, IList{int}, IList{int}, IList{int}, ArrayType)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from items. Must be a proper distribution. If all elements are uniform, the result will be uniform.
Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except array. Because the factor is deterministic, items is integrated out before taking the logarithm. The formula is exp(sum_(indices,indices2,indices3) p(indices,indices2,indices3) log(sum_items p(items) factor(items,array,indices,indices2,indices3))).

message_doc.name: ArrayAverageLogarithm{ArrayType, DistributionArrayArrayType, DistributionArrayType, DistributionType}(IList{T}, IList{int}, IList{int}, IList{int}, ArrayType)
message_doc.param: Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except array. Because the factor is deterministic, items is integrated out before taking the logarithm. The formula is exp(sum_(indices,indices2,indices3) p(indices,indices2,indices3) log(sum_items p(items) factor(items,array,indices,indices2,indices3))).

message_doc.name: LogAverageFactor(IList{IList{T}}, IList{IList{T}}, IList{IList{int}}, IList{IList{int}})
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's average value across the given argument distributions.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(items,array,indices,indices2) p(items,array,indices,indices2) factor(items,array,indices,indices2)).

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio(IList{IList{T}}, IList{IList{T}}, IList{IList{int}}, IList{IList{int}})
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's contribution the EP model evidence.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(items,array,indices,indices2) p(items,array,indices,indices2) factor(items,array,indices,indices2) / sum_items p(items) messageTo(items)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.param: Incoming message from items. Must be a proper distribution. If all elements are uniform, the result will be uniform.
Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except array. Because the factor is deterministic, items is integrated out before taking the logarithm. The formula is exp(sum_(indices,indices2) p(indices,indices2) log(sum_items p(items) factor(items,array,indices,indices2))).

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of innerProduct as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(innerProduct) sum_(a,b) p(a,b) factor(innerProduct,a,b)]/p(innerProduct).

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of b as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(b) sum_(innerProduct,a) p(innerProduct,a) factor(innerProduct,a,b)]/p(b).

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(a,b) p(a,b) factor(innerProduct,a,b)).

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio(Gaussian, VectorGaussian, VectorGaussian)

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(innerProduct,a,b) p(innerProduct,a,b) factor(innerProduct,a,b) / sum_innerProduct p(innerProduct) messageTo(innerProduct)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(innerProduct,a) p(innerProduct,a) factor(innerProduct,a,b) / sum_innerProduct p(innerProduct) messageTo(innerProduct)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.name: AAverageLogarithm{GaussianList}(Gaussian, IList{Gaussian}, IList{Gaussian}, GaussianList)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from innerProduct. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
Incoming message from b. Must be a proper distribution. If any element is uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the a argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except a. Because the factor is deterministic, innerProduct is integrated out before taking the logarithm. The formula is exp(sum_(b) p(b) log(sum_innerProduct p(innerProduct) factor(innerProduct,a,b))).

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the factor viewed as a function of a with innerProduct integrated out. The formula is sum_innerProduct p(innerProduct) factor(innerProduct,a,b).

message_doc.returns: The outgoing EP message to the lowerBound argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of lowerBound as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(lowerBound) sum_(isBetween,x,upperBound) p(isBetween,x,upperBound) factor(isBetween,x,lowerBound,upperBound)]/p(lowerBound).

message_doc.name: UpperBoundAverageConditional_Slow(Bernoulli, Gaussian, Gaussian, Gaussian)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from isBetween. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.

message_doc.name: UpperBoundAverageConditional(Bernoulli, Gaussian, Gaussian, Gaussian, double)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from isBetween. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing EP message to the upperBound argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of upperBound as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(upperBound) sum_(isBetween,x,lowerBound) p(isBetween,x,lowerBound) factor(isBetween,x,lowerBound,upperBound)]/p(upperBound).

message_doc.name: XAverageConditional_Slow(Bernoulli, Gaussian, Gaussian, Gaussian)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from isBetween. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.

message_doc.name: XAverageConditional(Bernoulli, Gaussian, Gaussian, Gaussian, double)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from isBetween. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing EP message to the x argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of x as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(x) sum_(isBetween,lowerBound,upperBound) p(isBetween,lowerBound,upperBound) factor(isBetween,x,lowerBound,upperBound)]/p(x).

message_doc.name: IsBetweenAverageLogarithm(Gaussian, Gaussian, Gaussian)
message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the isBetween argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of isBetween as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[sum_(x,lowerBound,upperBound) p(x,lowerBound,upperBound) factor(isBetween,x,lowerBound,upperBound)].

message_doc.name: XAverageLogarithm(Bernoulli, Gaussian, Gaussian, Gaussian)
message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the x argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except x. Because the factor is deterministic, isBetween is integrated out before taking the logarithm. The formula is exp(sum_(lowerBound,upperBound) p(lowerBound,upperBound) log(sum_isBetween p(isBetween) factor(isBetween,x,lowerBound,upperBound))).

message_doc.name: LowerBoundAverageLogarithm(Bernoulli, Gaussian, Gaussian, Gaussian)
message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the lowerBound argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except lowerBound. Because the factor is deterministic, isBetween is integrated out before taking the logarithm. The formula is exp(sum_(x,upperBound) p(x,upperBound) log(sum_isBetween p(isBetween) factor(isBetween,x,lowerBound,upperBound))).

message_doc.name: UpperBoundAverageLogarithm(Bernoulli, Gaussian, Gaussian, Gaussian)
message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the upperBound argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except upperBound. Because the factor is deterministic, isBetween is integrated out before taking the logarithm. The formula is exp(sum_(x,lowerBound) p(x,lowerBound) log(sum_isBetween p(isBetween) factor(isBetween,x,lowerBound,upperBound))).

message_doc.name: XAverageLogarithm(bool, Gaussian, double, double, Gaussian)
message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the x argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the factor viewed as a function of x conditioned on the given values.

message_doc.name: AverageLogFactor(bool, Gaussian, double, double, Gaussian)
message_doc.returns: Zero.

remarks.para: In Variational Message Passing, the evidence contribution of a deterministic factor is zero. Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for VMP.

message_doc.returns: The outgoing EP message to the b argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of b as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(b) sum_(isGreaterThan,a) p(isGreaterThan,a) factor(isGreaterThan,a,b)]/p(b).

message_doc.returns: The outgoing EP message to the a argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the factor viewed as a function of a conditioned on the given values.

message_doc.returns: The outgoing EP message to the b argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the factor viewed as a function of b conditioned on the given values.

message_doc.name: LogAverageFactor(bool, double)
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's average value across the given argument distributions.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(factor(isPositive,x)).

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio(bool, double)
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's contribution the EP model evidence.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(factor(isPositive,x)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.name: AverageLogFactor(bool, double)
message_doc.returns: Zero.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(factor(isPositive,x)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for VMP.

message_doc.name: LogAverageFactor(bool, Gaussian)
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's average value across the given argument distributions.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(x) p(x) factor(isPositive,x)).

message_doc.name: LogAverageFactor(Bernoulli, Gaussian)
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's average value across the given argument distributions.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(isPositive,x) p(isPositive,x) factor(isPositive,x)).

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio(Bernoulli, Gaussian)
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's contribution the EP model evidence.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(isPositive,x) p(isPositive,x) factor(isPositive,x) / sum_isPositive p(isPositive) messageTo(isPositive)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio(bool, Gaussian)
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's contribution the EP model evidence.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(x) p(x) factor(isPositive,x)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.name: IsPositiveAverageConditional(Gaussian)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from x. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing EP message to the isPositive argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of isPositive as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(isPositive) sum_(x) p(x) factor(isPositive,x)]/p(isPositive).

message_doc.param: Index of the items for which a message is desired.
Modified to contain the outgoing message.

message_doc.param: Incoming message from items. Must be a proper distribution. If all elements are uniform, the result will be uniform.
Modified to contain the outgoing message.

message_doc.param: Modified to contain the outgoing message.

message_doc.name: ItemsAverageLogarithm{DistributionType, ItemType, ResultType}(IReadOnlyList{DistributionType}, IReadOnlyList{IReadOnlyList{int}}, ResultType)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from array. Must be a proper distribution. If all elements are uniform, the result will be uniform.
Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of items as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[sum_(array,indices) p(array,indices) factor(items,array,indices)].

message_doc.name: ArrayAverageLogarithm{DistributionType, ArrayType}(IReadOnlyList{IReadOnlyList{DistributionType}}, IReadOnlyList{IReadOnlyList{int}}, ArrayType)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from items. Must be a proper distribution. If all elements are uniform, the result will be uniform.
Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except array. Because the factor is deterministic, items is integrated out before taking the logarithm. The formula is exp(sum_(indices) p(indices) log(sum_items p(items) factor(items,array,indices))).

message_doc.name: ArrayAverageLogarithm{DistributionType, ArrayType}(IReadOnlyList{IReadOnlyList{int}}, IReadOnlyList{IReadOnlyList{T}}, ArrayType)

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(log,d) p(log,d) factor(log,d)).

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio(Gaussian, Gamma, Gaussian)
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's contribution the EP model evidence.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(log,d) p(log,d) factor(log,d) / sum_log p(log) messageTo(log)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio(double, Gamma)
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's contribution the EP model evidence.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(d) p(d) factor(log,d)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.name: DAverageConditional(Gaussian, double)
message_doc.returns: The outgoing EP message to the d argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of d as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(d) sum_(log) p(log) factor(log,d)]/p(d).

message_doc.name: DAverageConditional(Gaussian, Gamma, Gaussian)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from log. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of d as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(d) sum_(log) p(log) factor(log,d)]/p(d).

message_doc.returns: The outgoing EP message to the d argument.

message_doc.param: Incoming message from A. Must be a proper distribution. If any element is uniform, the result will be uniform.

message_doc.name: AAverageLogarithm(DistributionStructArray2D{Gaussian, double}, DistributionStructArray2D{Gaussian, double}, DistributionStructArray2D{Gaussian, double}, DistributionStructArray2D{Gaussian, double})
message_doc.param: Incoming message from matrixMultiply. Must be a proper distribution. If any element is uniform, the result will be uniform.
Incoming message from B. Must be a proper distribution. If any element is uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the A argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except A. Because the factor is deterministic, matrixMultiply is integrated out before taking the logarithm. The formula is exp(sum_(B) p(B) log(sum_matrixMultiply p(matrixMultiply) factor(matrixMultiply,A,B))).

message_doc.name: AAverageLogarithm(DistributionStructArray2D{Gaussian, double}, DistributionStructArray2D{Gaussian, double}, double[,], DistributionStructArray2D{Gaussian, double})
message_doc.param: Incoming message from matrixMultiply. Must be a proper distribution. If any element is uniform, the result will be uniform.
Incoming message from A. Must be a proper distribution. If any element is uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the A argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the factor viewed as a function of A with matrixMultiply integrated out. The formula is sum_matrixMultiply p(matrixMultiply) factor(matrixMultiply,A,B).

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(A) p(A) factor(matrixMultiply,A,B)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.name: MatrixMultiplyAverageConditional(double[,], DistributionStructArray2D{Gaussian, double}, DistributionStructArray2D{Gaussian, double})
message_doc.param: Incoming message from B. Must be a proper distribution. If any element is uniform, the result will be uniform.
Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of matrixMultiply as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(matrixMultiply) sum_(B) p(B) factor(matrixMultiply,A,B)]/p(matrixMultiply).

message_doc.returns: The outgoing EP message to the max argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of max as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(max) sum_(val1) p(val1) factor(max,val1,val2)]/p(max).

message_doc.name: MaxAverageConditional(double, TruncatedGamma)
message_doc.returns: The outgoing EP message to the max argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of max as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(max) sum_(val2) p(val2) factor(max,val1,val2)]/p(max).

message_doc.name: AAverageConditional(TruncatedGamma, double)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from max. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing EP message to the val1 argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of val1 as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(val1) sum_(max) p(max) factor(max,val1,val2)]/p(val1).

message_doc.name: BAverageConditional(TruncatedGamma, double)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from max. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing EP message to the val2 argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of val2 as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(val2) sum_(max) p(max) factor(max,val1,val2)]/p(val2).

doc.summary: Provides outgoing messages for , given random arguments to the function.

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio(double, double, Gamma)
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's contribution the EP model evidence.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(val2) p(val2) factor(min,val1,val2)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio(TruncatedGamma, Gamma, double)
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's contribution the EP model evidence.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(min,val1) p(min,val1) factor(min,val1,val2) / sum_min p(min) messageTo(min)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

doc.summary:
Provides outgoing messages for the following factors:
, given random arguments to the function.

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio(IList{Discrete})
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's contribution the EP model evidence.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(multinomial) p(multinomial) factor(multinomial,trialCount,probs) / sum_multinomial p(multinomial) messageTo(multinomial)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.name: LogAverageFactor(IList{int}, int, IList{double})
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's average value across the given argument distributions.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(multinomial,probs) p(multinomial,probs) factor(multinomial,trialCount,probs)).

message_doc.name: LogAverageFactor(IList{int}, int, Dirichlet)
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's average value across the given argument distributions.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(multinomial,probs) p(multinomial,probs) factor(multinomial,trialCount,probs)).

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio(IList{int}, int, Dirichlet)
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's contribution the EP model evidence.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(multinomial,probs) p(multinomial,probs) factor(multinomial,trialCount,probs) / sum_multinomial p(multinomial) messageTo(multinomial)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio(IList{int}, int, IList{double})
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's contribution the EP model evidence.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(multinomial,probs) p(multinomial,probs) factor(multinomial,trialCount,probs) / sum_multinomial p(multinomial) messageTo(multinomial)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.name: PAverageConditional(IList{int}, int)
message_doc.returns: The outgoing EP message to the probs argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of probs as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(probs) sum_(multinomial) p(multinomial) factor(multinomial,trialCount,probs)]/p(probs).

message_doc.name: AverageLogFactor(IList{int}, int, IList{double})
message_doc.returns: Average of the factor's log-value across the given argument distributions.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is sum_(multinomial,probs) p(multinomial,probs) log(factor(multinomial,trialCount,probs)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for VMP.

message_doc.name: MeanLog(Dirichlet)
message_doc.returns: New value of buffer MeanLog.

message_doc.name: AverageLogFactor(IList{int}, int, Dirichlet, Vector)
message_doc.returns: Average of the factor's log-value across the given argument distributions.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is sum_(multinomial,probs) p(multinomial,probs) log(factor(multinomial,trialCount,probs)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for VMP.

message_doc.name: PAverageLogarithm(IList{int}, int)
message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the probs argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except probs. The formula is exp(sum_(multinomial) p(multinomial) log(factor(multinomial,trialCount,probs))).

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(b) p(b) factor(not,b)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.name: NotAverageLogarithm(Bernoulli)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from b. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.

message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the productExp argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of productExp as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[sum_(b) p(b) factor(productExp,a,b)].

message_doc.name: AAverageLogarithm(Gaussian, Gaussian)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from productExp. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
Incoming message from b. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the a argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except a. Because the factor is deterministic, productExp is integrated out before taking the logarithm. The formula is exp(sum_(b) p(b) log(sum_productExp p(productExp) factor(productExp,a,b))).

message_doc.name: AAverageLogarithm(double, Gaussian)

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except a. The formula is exp(sum_(b) p(b) log(factor(productExp,a,b))).

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio(Gamma, Gamma, double)

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(ratio,a) p(ratio,a) factor(ratio,a,b) / sum_ratio p(ratio) messageTo(ratio)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of a as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(a) sum_(product) p(product) factor(product,a,b)]/p(a).

message_doc.name: AverageLogFactor(Wishart)
message_doc.returns: Zero.

remarks.para: In Variational Message Passing, the evidence contribution of a deterministic factor is zero. Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for VMP.

message_doc.name: BAverageLogarithm(Wishart, Wishart)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from product. Must be a proper distribution. If any element is uniform, the result will be uniform.
Incoming message from a. Must be a proper distribution. If any element is uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the b argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except b. Because the factor is deterministic, product is integrated out before taking the logarithm. The formula is exp(sum_(a) p(a) log(sum_product p(product) factor(product,a,b))).

Incoming message from x. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
Incoming message from y. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the angle argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except angle. Because the factor is deterministic, rotate is integrated out before taking the logarithm. The formula is exp(sum_(x,y) p(x,y) log(sum_rotate p(rotate) factor(rotate,x,y,angle))).

message_doc.name: AngleAverageLogarithm(VectorGaussian, double, double)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from rotate. Must be a proper distribution. If any element is uniform, the result will be uniform.
message_doc.returns: The outgoing VMP message to the angle argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the factor viewed as a function of angle with rotate integrated out. The formula is sum_rotate p(rotate) factor(rotate,x,y,angle).

doc.summary: Provides outgoing messages for , given random arguments to the function.

message_doc.name: FactorAverageConditional{T}(T, T, double, double, T)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from variable. Must be a proper distribution. If uniform, the result will be uniform.
Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of factor as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(factor) sum_(variable) p(variable) factor(factor,variable,variableAlpha,factorAlpha)]/p(factor).

message_doc.name: VariableAverageConditional{T}(T, T)

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of variable as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(variable) sum_(factor) p(factor) factor(factor,variable,variableAlpha,factorAlpha)]/p(variable).

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(array,head,tail) p(array,head,tail) factor(head,array,count,tail) / sum_head p(head) messageTo(head)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio{ItemType}(IReadOnlyList{ItemType}, IReadOnlyList{T}, int, IReadOnlyList{ItemType})

message_doc.name: ArrayAverageConditional{ArrayType, ItemType}(IReadOnlyList{ItemType}, int, IReadOnlyList{ItemType}, ArrayType)
message_doc.param: Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of array as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(array) sum_(head,tail) p(head,tail) factor(head,array,count,tail)]/p(array).

message_doc.name: AverageLogFactor()
message_doc.returns: Zero.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(factor(head,array,count,tail)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for VMP.

message_doc.name: ArrayAverageLogarithm{ArrayType, ItemType}(IReadOnlyList{ItemType}, int, IReadOnlyList{ItemType}, ArrayType)
message_doc.param: Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except array. Because the factor is deterministic, head is integrated out before taking the logarithm. The formula is exp(sum_(tail) p(tail) log(sum_head p(head) factor(head,array,count,tail))).

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(factor(Uses,Def,count,Marginal)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for VMP.

message_doc.name: MarginalAverageLogarithm{T}(IReadOnlyList{T}, T, T)
message_doc.param: Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except Marginal. The formula is exp(sum_(Uses,Def) p(Uses,Def) log(factor(Uses,Def,count,Marginal))).

message_doc.name: DefAverageLogarithm{T}(IReadOnlyList{T}, T, T)
message_doc.param: Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is the exponential of the average log-factor value, where the average is over all arguments except Def. The formula is exp(sum_(Uses) p(Uses) log(factor(Uses,Def,count,Marginal))).

message_doc.name: LogEvidenceRatio{T}(T)
message_doc.returns: Logarithm of the factor's contribution the EP model evidence.

remarks.para: The formula for the result is log(sum_(use) p(use) factor(use,def,marginal) / sum_use p(use) messageTo(use)). Adding up these values across all factors and variables gives the log-evidence estimate for EP.

message_doc.name: MarginalAverageConditional{T}(T, T, T)
message_doc.param: Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of marginal as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(marginal) sum_(use,def) p(use,def) factor(use,def,marginal)]/p(marginal).

message_doc.name: MarginalAverageConditional{TDist, T}(T, TDist)
message_doc.param: Modified to contain the outgoing message.

message_doc.name: DefAverageConditional{T}(T)
message_doc.returns: The outgoing EP message to the def argument.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of def as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(def) sum_(use) p(use) factor(use,def,marginal)]/p(def).

message_doc.name: SampleAverageConditional2(double, Wishart, Wishart, Wishart)
message_doc.param: Incoming message from rate. Must be a proper distribution. If any element is uniform, the result will be uniform.

message_doc.param: Incoming message from rate. Must be a proper distribution. If any element is uniform, the result will be uniform.
Modified to contain the outgoing message.

remarks.para: The outgoing message is a distribution matching the moments of sample as the random arguments are varied. The formula is proj[p(sample) sum_(rate) p(rate) factor(sample,shape,rate)]/p(sample).
